page.title: 20AND EDGEFIELD NOW
page.content: The farmer's wife went on,"It's like two generations missing, there are so few teenagers and 20year olds. The youngsters have to go, not just for work, but to get a house. The council isn't building any, and the old ones are too expensive. Nearly all the young men who were at school with my boys have gone now. Farming's changed -the hedges have gone to make bigger fields, everything gets sprayed with weedkillers and pesticides, where there were five men working there's now only one. It's nearly all retired people moving in, from all over the country -foreigners." She said the last word with a twinkle, and one knows that she is still happy to live in Edgefield and welcome 'foreigners' to it.
